page.title: 15LIFESTYLES
page.content: Most people in this area are Americans living at RAF Woodbridge. Unavoidably, their lives are insulated within thw base and most people are very family orientated. Even so, many like to get off base to travel and sightsee. Eve- nings are usually spent at home, some- times with friends, perhaps for a game of "Peaknuckle", a card game not known in England. At Christmas families usu- ally invite one of the single people living on base to spend the day with them. There is family support provided especially for young families who are homesick. Most local people have rela- tives living nearby and visit at week- ends. Evenings might be spent at home, or perhaps at the local pub or evening class. This area is not particularly fashion-conscious, clothes are usually country-casual and homes are tradi- tionally furnished.
